articles.title: US capture of Maduro divides a changed region, thrilling Trump’s allies and threatening his foes
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — In his celebratory news conference on the U.S. capture of Venezuelan strongman leader Nicolás Maduro, President Donald Trump set out an extraordinarily forthright view of the use of U.S. power in Latin America that exposed political divisions from Mexico to Argentina as Trump-frie

articles.title: Trump warns new Venezuelan leader as Maduro set to appear in court
articles.description: Trump said Venezuela's interim president Delcy Rodríguez could "pay a very big price, probably bigger than Maduro" if she "doesn't do what's right".

articles.title: This CRISPR breakthrough turns genes on without cutting DNA
articles.description: A new CRISPR breakthrough shows scientists can turn genes back on without cutting DNA, by removing chemical tags that act like molecular anchors. The work confirms these tags actively silence genes, settling a long-running scientific debate. This gentler form of gene editing could offer a safer way

articles.title: Trial begins for officer accused of failing to protect children during Uvalde school shooting
articles.description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas (AP) — One of the first police officers to respond to the 2022 school shooting in Uvalde, Texas, goes on trial Monday on charges that he failed to protect children during the attack, when authorities waited more than an hour to confront the gunman. articles.title: Plants can’t absorb as much CO2 as climate models predicted
articles.description: CO2 can stimulate plant growth, but only when enough nitrogen is available—and that key ingredient has been seriously miscalculated. A new study finds that natural nitrogen fixation has been overestimated by about 50 percent in major climate models. This means the climate-cooling benefits of plant g

articles.title: Canada falls to Czechia in medal round for third straight year at world juniors
articles.description: Canada will play for bronze at the world junior hockey championship. Tomas Poletin scored with 1:14 left in the third period as Czechia ended Canadian gold-medal dreams for a third straight year with a 6-4 victory in the semifinals at the men’s under-20 tournament Sunday. articles.title: Scientists find a safer way to make cells burn more calories
articles.description: Researchers have developed experimental compounds that make cells burn more calories by subtly tweaking how mitochondria produce energy. articles.title: Bluefin tuna sells for record $3.2 million at year-opening auction at Tokyo fish market
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — A 243-kilogram (535-pound) bluefin tuna sold for a record 510 million yen ($3.2 million) at the first auction of 2026 at Tokyo’s Toyosu fish market. The top bidder for the prized tuna at the predawn auction on Monday was Kiyomura Corp., whose owner Kiyoshi Kimura runs the popular
